tool_description: Removes or replaces personally identifiable information from DICOM files according to HIPAA and DICOM anonymization standards.

input_file_path.description: Path to the source DICOM file to anonymize

output_file_path.description: Path where anonymized DICOM file will be saved

anonymization_profile.description: Predefined anonymization profile (basic, full, research, clinical_trial)

preserve_study_structure.description: Maintain study and series relationships during anonymization

custom_patient_id.description: Custom patient ID to replace original (auto-generated if not provided)

date_offset_days.description: Number of days to offset all dates (maintains temporal relationships)

error_messages: Input file not accessible: Cannot read the source DICOM file. Verify file path and permissions.
Output path invalid: Cannot write to specified output path. Check directory permissions and disk space.
Invalid anonymization profile: Use one of [basic, full, research, clinical_trial].
Anonymization failed: Error during anonymization process. Check file integrity and retry.
Date offset out of range: date_offset_days must be between -36500 and 36500 (Â±100 years).
usage: Provide input_file_path and output_file_path, then configure anonymization settings. The tool creates anonymized DICOM files while preserving medical imaging data integrity.

tags_modified.description: List of DICOM tags that were modified or removed
